feature_1.description: Plot structure centered on quest for ancient artifact
feature_1.reasoning: Both films revolve around the pursuit of a powerful historical object, with similar narrative beats of research, rival seekers, and dangerous journeys.

feature_2.description: Character dynamics between protagonist, love interest, and antagonists
feature_2.reasoning: Both feature an academic adventurer as protagonist, a strong-willed female companion, and rival treasure hunters, though specific character details differ.

feature_3.description: Setting and time period of the adventures
feature_3.reasoning: While 'Raiders' is set in 1936 and 'National Treasure' is contemporary, both involve globe-trotting quests and exploration of historical sites.

feature_4.reasoning: Both films feature elaborate chases, fights, and puzzle-solving with brisk pacing, though 'Raiders' has more intense violence.

feature_5.description: Themes of history, artifact power, and danger
feature_5.reasoning: Both explore historical mysteries and the power of artifacts in the wrong hands, but 'National Treasure' has a stronger focus on patriotism and American history.
